result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Heidi M. Wiltzius was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and taken with prior, written authorization of agent.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department.
State notes if defendant successfully completes DEOJ on count 1, it will move to dismiss that count.
Court finds the defendant is not entitled to any jail credit if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same as shown under count 2 in this file.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order for Dismissal Count One
Review hearing on January 13, 2017 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Heidi M. Wiltzius
Current: 1816 Lenard St, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 05-28-2015)
Prior: 105 E Thronson Drive, Edgerton, WI 53534 United States
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement - placement with volunteers in probation program
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:05 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Zachary Glascock.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to file amended information. COURT grants. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs/Conspiracy to Commit)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty, and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement with amendments. 
                           : On Cts. 2 & 3>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and taken with prior, written authorization of agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service; 20 hours community service; payment of court costs. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ on Ct. 1, it will move to dismiss that count. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
Review of DEOJ set for January 13, 2017 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
Adj: 9:21 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Zachary Glascock.

Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
Court advises parties to see JA to set future dates. 
Bond continues.

Preliminary Hearing on September 24, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2014 at 09:40 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  D.H.
